def show_color_hist(label, pick_count=20):
    img_filename_list = train.loc[train['label']==label, 'image_id'].to_list()
    
    for f in img_filename_list[:pick_count]:
        
        img_path = train_img_path + f

        fig, (axL, axR) = plt.subplots(ncols=2, figsize=(10,4))

        im = Image.open(img_path)

        im_array = np.asarray(im)
        axL.imshow(im_array)

        im_array_rgb = np.asarray(im.convert("RGB")).reshape(-1,3)
        axR.hist(im_array_rgb, color=["red", "green", "blue"], histtype="step", bins=256)

        fig.show()

# My Consideration

I think there are 3 types of photos in this dataset.

- One leaf
- Leaves and background
- Roots

Color  depends on background.
If background is leaves, color histogram is like a normal distribution.
If background is soil, color histogram is a biased distribution.

Unfortunately, there is no difference between color histogram of each labels.

Some labels are suspicious.
